Well, they can't just disable the on-screen keyboard, but they might be able to actually adjust the UI offset to accommodate on-screen keyboards. In fact, I think mcpe used to work like that, though maybe I am mistaken.

Yes I agree

The on screen keyboard messes up writing in a book and quill and it makes fixing typos while doing commands a lot more difficult.

I personal play on mouse and keyboard, and would prefer having a toggle to switch the Xbox keyboard on and off, so I can type commands more efficiently, and can actually use the command pop up. That way I don't have to keep retyping the same command when I need it more then once.

Please fix this or add a toggle, so that it makes my time playing more enjoyable.

I double down on this. Should have an option to disable the bedrock on screen keyboard. When using a controller, then trying to use my KB, the KB menu just constantly appears. It works correctly when using the controller but it doesn't help when I want to switch to my IRL keyboard to type.

I am deaf in my right ear and this would be soo helpful
i want to be able to listen to my favorite disk (otherside) and mine while not looking at it at the same time

hi! i have the same exact problem as you, microtia in the right ear. i also think minecraft should have this feature, but just to help people out i have some alternatives to make the game more accessible:

- depending on the nature of your deafness, try different headphones. my hearing loss is conductive, which means by using bone conduction headphones designed for people like me, i can enjoy stereo sound. i use Trekz.

- turn on mono audio mixing. this is an audio setting on most computers. all sounds will play in both ears equally. i do not prefer this solution because although it works, in my experience it also significantly reduces your sound quality (i have absolutely no idea why this happens.) but it's a solution!

- turn on subtitles. i have these always on by default, they subtitle almost every sound in the game and the direction it's coming from. incredibly helpful.

i would greatly appreciate an accessibility feature that allows the players to customize sound panning. the subtitles are a great step in the right direction, but unfortunately hearing loss that affects each side differently is a relatively common experience that does not get a lot of attention, and doesn't have many easy solutions.

Larger simulation distance would help with large villages.  Villages often break when they are larger than simulation distance.  Allowing us to at least temporarily increase simulation distance could help fix this.

we really need this to be a thing, hell I'd even take being actually have to have NBT data edits stick on bedrock level.dat files for changing the "serverChunkTickRange" setting if we want to use a higher simulation distance than 12 chunks, but 12 chunks is massively limiting and honestly stupidly restrictive for those of us playing on PC with decent hardware, I have to get to 50 chunks plus render distance with vibrant visuals before my framerate gets too choppy and that's double what the default cap for vibrant visuals, my PC can handle 35 chunk render distance and a 30 chunk simulation distance. Hell in java edition with distant horizons mod and sodium I can do 512 chunk viewing distance with over 30 chunk simulation distance and shades on as well and still be in the 80-110FPS range, there is 0 reason to restrict bedrock to such silly arbitrarily low simulation distances

Yes please! I'm hearing impaired myself and recently got pocket edition because my computer is with my sister and I relied heavily on the subtitles to know what was happening around me while mining. Now with pocket edition I'm struggling heavily and dying every five seconds because of creepers sneaking up on me because I cannot hear them.
This needs to be in the game
That looks really cool!!
I like it :D
